Home cookin'
 




Everyone wants to be close to Baron's greatness.  (Getty Images)



      When the Warriors play at home, they already hold a distinct advantage 
      -- the loudest arena in the NBA, 
      Tony Mejia says. Golden State rolls in Game 3 and lays a whoopin' 
      on Utah to win 125-105 in a game 
      never in doubt.
    

  
 Related Links:• Jazz hit wall | Series | West: Suns 1, Spurs 1 | Playoffs: Leaders | Picks• East: Cavs 2, Nets 0 | Pistons 3, Bulls 0 | Mejia: New mailbag | Draft


 


 

 





 The Players Championship: Mickelson struggles least


    

      
      The revamped TPC at Sawgrass bares its teeth to the 
      best, and No. 1 Tiger Woods barely makes the cut. Steve Elling 
      says Phil Mickelson is a surprise leader at 5 under.
    

  
• Lefty in lead | Board | Tiger | Lefty | Tee times | More


 

 





 Prisco: Grades finally in (sorry Bucs) for Class of '04


    

      
      It's time to assess the '04 draft 
      class and with three years under the belt, a proper evaluation can take 
      place. The Bucs flunk; the Bolts, Bears and Jets drafted with honors.
